items.label: Weeks 11-13: VLA Models and Humanoid Robotics

deployment_guide.title: Deployment Guide: RAG Chatbot for Published Book

setup-guides/cloud-native/setup.title: Cloud-Native Environment Setup
setup-guides/cloud-native/setup.description: This guide will help you set up a cloud-based development environment for the Physical AI Humanoid Robotics course.

setup-guides/digital-twin-workstation/se.title: Digital Twin Workstation Setup
setup-guides/digital-twin-workstation/se.description: This guide will help you set up a local development environment with digital twin capabilities for the Physical AI Humanoid Robotics course.

setup-guides/intro.title: Platform Setup Guides
setup-guides/intro.description: This section provides detailed instructions for setting up your development environment for the Physical AI Humanoid Robotics course. You can choose from three platform options based on your available resources and preferences.

setup-guides/physical-ai-edge-kit/setup.title: Physical AI Edge Kit Setup
setup-guides/physical-ai-edge-kit/setup.description: This guide will help you set up the Physical AI Edge Kit hardware for the Physical AI Humanoid Robotics course.

textbook/capstone/intro.title: Capstone: Autonomous Humanoid Pipeline
textbook/capstone/intro.description: This capstone project integrates all concepts learned throughout the course to build an autonomous humanoid pipeline that processes speech commands and executes complex tasks involving planning, navigation, perception, and manipulation.

textbook/digital-twin/intro.title: Weeks 6-7: Digital Twin Workflows
textbook/digital-twin/intro.description: This section covers digital twin concepts and workflows - virtual replicas of physical systems used for simulation, testing, and optimization. You'll learn how to create and use digital twins for robotics development and testing.

textbook/foundations/intro.title: Weeks 1-2: Foundations of Physical AI
textbook/foundations/intro.description: This section covers the fundamental concepts of Physical AI - the integration of artificial intelligence with physical systems. You'll learn how AI algorithms interact with the real world through sensors, actuators, and control systems.

textbook/intro.title: Physical AI Humanoid Robotics Textbook
textbook/intro.description: Welcome to the comprehensive guide to Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics. This textbook supports a 13-week training program for industry engineers with Python knowledge, covering essential topics from foundational concepts through advanced humanoid robotics applications.

textbook/nvidia-isaac/intro.title: Weeks 8-10: NVIDIA Isaac
textbook/nvidia-isaac/intro.description: This section introduces NVIDIA Isaac - a comprehensive robotics platform that includes Isaac Sim for simulation and Isaac ROS for perception and navigation. You'll learn how to leverage NVIDIA's GPU-accelerated tools for robotics development.

textbook/ros2/intro.title: Weeks 3-5: ROS 2
textbook/ros2/intro.description: This section introduces the Robot Operating System (ROS 2) - a flexible framework for writing robot software. You'll learn about ROS 2 architecture, nodes, topics, services, and how to use ROS 2 with Python for robotics applications.

textbook/vla-humanoid/intro.title: Weeks 11-13: VLA Models and Humanoid Robotics
textbook/vla-humanoid/intro.description: This section explores Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models and their applications in humanoid robotics. You'll learn how to implement and use VLA models for complex robotic tasks and human-robot interaction.
